WRT interstage fairings, I am all in favor of seeing if they can be implemented. These are just a few ideas which might be helpful (I figure you've considered most of them though)

1. They need to work if building up the rocket as well as building down the rocket

2. They would ideally auto strut the non-parented side, such that the fairing itself will contribute to a stable ship

3. They might ideally come in variable symmetry, or at least a 4x and 2x
If Squad doesnt employee you to help finish the game they are mental this is seriously good stuff now using it for everything well done !!!!

Updated to 1.1, now with conic side fairings option and (hopefully) better ejection.

I fixed a bug in FAR that prevented it from shielding the payload, and I'm going to contact Ferram about that.

So, you'll need a new version of FAR to use procedural fairings with it.

Under what files do I put everything. I cant get the parts to show up in the VAB

You should unzip it to GameData folder, just like everything else in 0.20. The parts are in Aero tab.

Someone get this man a medal. I love how you made it work with non-symmetrical rockets so it will draw the fairing out to the farthest side and make it symmetrical. This is really amazing.
Yes, I think this will do just fine. Its so top secret, even we don't know what it is.

I love it!

One minor nit: the names for the fairing side shapes are a bit confusing. To me, "capsule-shaped" invokes images of space capsules like the Command Pod Mk1 or Mk1-2, which are cone-shaped. I think the proper term for what you're calling "capsule-shaped" is "ellipsoid", although most people would call it "egg-shaped".

Edited July 9, 2013 by Gaius

I love it!

English is not my native language. "Egg-shaped" sounds very Kerbal though, I guess I'll use it in the next update.

Hmm...

I'm not sure if this is even possible, but could you look into the possibility of having a set of fairings that deleted the contained parts until they were opened? (For lag reduction, mainly. This would allow many people to launch much more complex payloads.)

There's a whole bunch of challenges with this, though. You'd have to transfer any enclosed resources into the fairing part itself, as well as dealing with mass and center of mass. It also would potentially have issues with command pods / probes inside the fairings.

Easy to use and very elegant. One of the very few mods I will install. Hoping to see mid-stage fairings in the future.

Great work!

This is a great mod!

A couple things come to mind as feedback:

-Separation is still violent compared to KW for instance)

-It seems that the fairings decouple when they are next up (ie fairings are stage 4 and will decouple if stage 5 is active. This also happens if you move them to the second to last stage in flight).

-Have not collided with payload in my experience (1.1)

-All fairings expand at the bottom, if they need to or not.
Well, that does it. I have the fairing solution that I've always dreamed of! Fantastic work, e-dog! And thank you!

For future adapters / interstage shroud that may come later, i hope that we can:

use some key to manually adjust diameters of upper/lower sides and height. and some hot-key to make diameter of lower side same as the upper side (also another hot key to do it in reverse). I guess it will be simpler (and more flexible) than automatically analyze the diameter of upper/lower stages by checking their bounding-boxes (which is also quite a lot of computation)
